turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about City of London Artillery.
turn.1: What happened in France in June 1940?
turn.2: In October, the 50th Division returned to the United Kingdom to prepare for the Normandy landings in which, once again, it would spearhead the amphibious attack.
turn.3: What happened with the City of London Artillery?
turn.4: After initial training with US-supplied M7 Priest self-propelled 105mm guns, 90 Field Regiment was equipped with Canadian-built Sexton self-propelled 25-pounder guns for this campaign, with Sherman V and Universal Carrier Observation Posts (OPs).
turn.6: The regiment practised landing from tank landing craft (LCTs).
turn.8: The 90th Field Regiment was assigned to support the assault of 231 Infantry Brigade Group on Jig Beach of the Gold Assault Area, the most westerly assault sector of British Second Army on D-Day.
turn.9: Did they have any other tanks?
turn.10: It also had two troops of the 1st Royal Marine Armoured Support Regiment equipped with Centaur IV tanks mounting 95mm howitzers.
turn.11: What else happened on the day of the landing?
turn.12: At 0650 the Sextons and Centaurs began their shoot from the landing craft on the run-in to the beach.
